Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is running for the Democratic presidential nomination against Joe Biden. While he is not likely to win, his campaign will draw a lot of attention. Kennedy has a long history of environmental activism and was once known for his passionate speeches. However, he has recently become known for his anti-vax crusade and for comparing pandemic restrictions to Nazi Germany. Kennedy is not running as a third-party candidate, which is a good thing as it could potentially lead to a candidate being elected who his supporters don't want. Ultimately, Kennedy's campaign will bring attention to the election and could potentially pose a problem for Biden if Kennedy wins the first two primaries.

  1. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is running for the Democratic presidential nomination against Joe Biden.
  2. Kennedy has claimed that Covid vaccinations are responsible for practically every evil in the world.
  3. Kennedy has a history of environmental activism and was once a popular speaker.
  4. Kennedy has a speech disorder called spasmodic dysphonia.
  5. Kennedy is not running as a third-party candidate, which could have been easier for him, but could also have had negative consequences for the Democratic party.
